author: Master_Wu
title: Worth Every Cent!
review:
This Minifigure is called the fox costume girl. Perhaps this wonderful costume is great for Halloween, or maybe just display; either way, it's a must-have for most Lego fans! 

The legs are black at the bottom which are made to look like feet, and the hands, being black as well, compliment the look nicely. The torso is pretty simple; it is all orange with black hands, and white furry chest printing. The head is double printed; one face shows a smile, and the other shows the girl licking her lips ready for a treat. 

This minifigure also wears an orange and white tail, and also a very nice brand new head piece. The chicken is in a new color which looks more realistic. The sack is nice as well.

Some of the parts may have simple printing, but this minifigure was a really fun one to obtain!

Please let me know if this review was helpful!

author: Odeinoichus
title: Oh No! Fox Girl got into the Hen House!
review:
Set #71025 Fox Costume Girl: This mischievous scoundrel of a thief has a sack in one hand, a chicken in the other and is proudly defying conventional wisdom as she lips her lips in anticipation of a good meal. Alternatively she has a confident smirk on her other expression.

With a new head piece for the Fox helmet, a familiar Chima era tail piece and a simple torso with fur printing on the front and some dual-moulded legs to round off the look, this Minifigure is a fun one to show up.

Overall I'm pleased to own two of this Minifigure, she's definitely a great addition for the Costume Menagerie set. Strongly Recommended.
